sentences.english: Ten nets are exquisite and regular, seemlingly having gained mercy of gods.
sentences.chinese: 網織的精巧而規矩，八卦形的張開，彷彿得到神主。

sentences.english: Depend on intuition and experience, he ases if the key that found baseball of the gold dollar that defeat solution.
sentences.chinese: 憑藉直覺和經驗，他彷彿找到了破解金元棒球的鑰匙。

sentences.english: Aloft in the air, as if from the depths of the cloud, came a confused and doubtful sound of voices.
sentences.chinese: 高空中，彷彿自雲團深處，傳來一片可疑的嘈雜人聲。

sentences.english: It seems that tourists begin a time and space travel and enter another world from there.
sentences.chinese: 遊人彷彿進入時空旅行一般，進入另一個世界。

sentences.english: The same thought came to me while trying out the upscale Italian restaurant Casa Mosaico.
sentences.chinese: 來到卡薩馬可意大利餐廳，心境彷彿又回到過去。

sentences.english: Softly press to wear make-up, as the closest comfort from the lover.
sentences.chinese: 以輕壓方式上妝，彷彿戀人最親密的愛撫。

sentences.english: It was as if the Night sang dirges with clenched teeth.
sentences.chinese: 那彷彿是夜神正在那兒咬牙切齒地唱輓歌。

sentences.english: Her delicate face flushed pink, her lips pouted softly, as if she were going to cry.
sentences.chinese: 她的臉激動的發紅，輕輕地撅着嘴，彷彿要哭似的。

sentences.english: He uttered the word indifferently, and as though his mind were on something else.
sentences.chinese: 他隨口說了這句話，彷彿他還在想着旁的事。

sentences.english: It's seems this part of the ancient text was indexical in nature!
sentences.chinese: 看彷彿這個段子的那古代的原文一次有了索引的種類。

sentences.english: Natasha looked with her big, wide eyes at Sonya as though not understanding her question.
sentences.chinese: 娜塔莎瞪大眼睛望着索尼婭，彷彿不明白她在問什麼。

sentences.english: As if unsure of where he is, she hesitated and looked around.
sentences.chinese: 她彷彿茫然不知聲身在何處，猶豫地向四周打量。

sentences.english: In this year, what my mind-mirror was my new life.
sentences.chinese: 在這一年裏，我的心鏡照出來的彷彿是我的新生。

sentences.english: Nevertheless, all these can be make one feel gentle and kind but not bustling.
sentences.chinese: 但是這樣也會給人一種溫吞的感覺，彷彿不夠熱烈。

sentences.english: Sad feeling like what's missing, sour, as if the lack of soul.
sentences.chinese: 心痛的感覺就像少了什麼，酸酸的，彷彿缺了靈魂。

sentences.english: He thought that he already distinctly perceived the brink of the bottomless abyss.
sentences.chinese: 他彷彿已清清楚楚地望見那無底深淵邊上的陡壁。

definition: an instant (Sanskrit: ksana)/split second/the twinkling of an eye
variant of 彌漫|弥漫[mi2 man4]
to catch and hold on/to continue/to go on to do sth/to follow/to carry on/then/after that/subsequently/to proceed/to ensue/in turn/in one's turn
the rear/far behind the front line
silvery light/bright white light/shining white light
to have one's eyes on (a goal)/having sth in mind/to concentrate
lit. heads rubbing together (idiom)/fig. very close relationship
